critique: The executive order seems to be a purely administrative document. It is unlikely that the president wants the audience to feel any particular emotion. The order simply states that corporation statistical transcript cards prepared by the Bureau of Internal Revenue from corporation income and declared value excess-profits tax returns made under the Internal Revenue Code, as amended, for any taxable year ending after June 30, 1941 and before July 1, 1942, shall be open to inspection by the Office of Price Administration. Therefore, the initial scores for all emotions should be 1.
